ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000F7bOq:ref

Hello Flaviu,
Yes, the instance is up and accessible. I'd love to regain ssh access to
the instance, how do I go about obtaining my credentials, which I believe
you said were "baked" into this AMI?
Thank you for checking in.

On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:53 AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
wrote:

> Hi Jeffrey,
>
> Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server
> with Ubuntu 22.04.
>
> After that we will proceed with the following steps:
>
> 1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
> 2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the
> logs).
> 3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP
> servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to
> the new server and send the logs there from now on.
> 4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP
> server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.
>
> Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in
> order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them
> we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.
>
> Best Regards,
> *Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer*
> Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
> DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced
> Encryption
> www.endpointprotector.com

Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #419597 - - Server OS Update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0F7bOq:ref ]

TextBody:
Hi Jeffrey,

We can schedule a remote session and create a new set of SSH access credentials for you on the new server.

Please let me know when you have time for a remote session this week.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000F7bOq:ref
 
Hello Flaviu,
Yes, the instance is up and accessible. I'd love to regain ssh access to the instance, how do I go about obtaining my credentials, which I believe you said were "baked" into this AMI?

Thank you for checking in.

 


On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:53 AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

Hi Jeffrey,

Thank you for the remote session!

As we spoke I believe an older EPP Server version was installed. We will wait to hear back from you once the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04 is installed.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

On Wed, Sep 4, 2024 at 10:29?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

We have just received an update from our colleagues.

We can provide you with an AWS image with the EPP server version 5.8.1.0. This we will upgrade afterwards when performing the migration to the latest 5.9.4.0 version.

Unfortunately we only have images on Ubuntu 22.04.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

www.endpointprotector.com

On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:53?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

Hi Jeffrey,

Thank you for the remote session!

As we spoke I believe an older EPP Server version was installed. We will wait to hear back from you once the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04 is installed.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

Hi Jeffrey,

We have just received an update from our colleagues.

We can provide you with an AWS image with the EPP server version 5.8.1.0. This we will upgrade afterwards when performing the migration to the latest 5.9.4.0 version.

Unfortunately we only have images on Ubuntu 22.04.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:53?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix

www.endpointprotector.com

Hi Jeffrey,

Thank you for the remote session!

As we spoke I believe an older EPP Server version was installed. We will wait to hear back from you once the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04 is installed.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

On Wed, Sep 4, 2024 at 10:29?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

We have just received an update from our colleagues.

We can provide you with an AWS image with the EPP server version 5.8.1.0. This we will upgrade afterwards when performing the migration to the latest 5.9.4.0 version.

Unfortunately we only have images on Ubuntu 22.04.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:53?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,

On Wed, Sep 4, 2024 at 10:29?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

We have just received an update from our colleagues.

We can provide you with an AWS image with the EPP server version 5.8.1.0. This we will upgrade afterwards when performing the migration to the latest 5.9.4.0 version.

Unfortunately we only have images on Ubuntu 22.04.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Best Regards,

On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:53?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]

To: jplotts@blend.com
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #419597 - - Server OS Update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0F7bOq:ref ]

Hi Jeffrey,

Thank you for the remote session!

As we spoke I believe an older EPP Server version was installed. We will wait to hear back from you once the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04 is installed.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

On Wed, Sep 4, 2024 at 10:29?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

We have just received an update from our colleagues.

We can provide you with an AWS image with the EPP server version 5.8.1.0. This we will upgrade afterwards when performing the migration to the latest 5.9.4.0 version.

Unfortunately we only have images on Ubuntu 22.04.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Best Regards,

>>>>> Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP
>>>>> server with Ubuntu 22.04.
>>>>>
>>>>> After that we will proceed with the following steps:
>>>>>
>>>>> 1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
>>>>> 2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain
>>>>> the logs).
>>>>> 3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP
>>>>> servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to
>>>>> the new server and send the logs there from now on.
>>>>> 4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new
>>>>> EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old
>>>>> one.
>>>>>
>>>>> Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host
>>>>> access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before
>>>>> installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:53?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

On Wed, Sep 4, 2024 at 10:29?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

We have just received an update from our colleagues.

We can provide you with an AWS image with the EPP server version 5.8.1.0. This we will upgrade afterwards when performing the migration to the latest 5.9.4.0 version.

Unfortunately we only have images on Ubuntu 22.04.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Best Regards,

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.

On Wed, Sep 4, 2024 at 10:29?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

We have just received an update from our colleagues.

We can provide you with an AWS image with the EPP server version 5.8.1.0. This we will upgrade afterwards when performing the migration to the latest 5.9.4.0 version.

Unfortunately we only have images on Ubuntu 22.04.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Best Regards,

Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #419597 - - Server OS Update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0F7bOq:ref ]

TextBody:
Hi Jeffrey,

Please find the answers below:
The EPP clients only care about the IP/DNS/FQDN used. I would recommend only swapping the IP's of the EPP servers, or updating the IP on the EPP clients once the migration is completed.
If we migrate the EPP server the certificates applied on the EPP server should also be present on the new EPP server after the migration is completed.

Regarding the preparatory steps that need to be taken before the migration, I would recommend having a remote session with us when you either migrate so we can assist. The most important steps prior to the migration are:
1. Creating a Snapshot of the EPP servers, so we have a point of return.
2. Making sure that both EPP servers are on the same EPP server version(this can be seen in the bottom-right corner of the EPP UI, the latest version is 5940).

Please let me know if there is any additional information that we can provide and if/when you would like to schedule a remote session with us to assist with the migration.

Best Regards,

On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:53?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,

On Wed, Sep 4, 2024 at 10:29?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

We have just received an update from our colleagues.

We can provide you with an AWS image with the EPP server version 5.8.1.0. This we will upgrade afterwards when performing the migration to the latest 5.9.4.0 version.

Unfortunately we only have images on Ubuntu 22.04.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Best Regards,

version, but it seems to be "stuck" at 87.5% "updating database". It's been

advance beyond this?

On Fri, Nov 8, 2024 at 2:18 PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
wrote:

> Hi Jeffrey,
>
> Please find the answers below:
> The EPP clients only care about the IP/DNS/FQDN used. I would recommend
> only swapping the IP's of the EPP servers, or updating the IP on the EPP
> clients once the migration is completed.
> If we migrate the EPP server the certificates applied on the EPP server
> should also be present on the new EPP server after the migration is
> completed.
>
> Regarding the preparatory steps that need to be taken before the
> migration, I would recommend having a remote session with us when you
> either migrate so we can assist. The most important steps prior to the
> migration are:
> 1. Creating a Snapshot of the EPP servers, so we have a point of return.
> 2. Making sure that both EPP servers are on the same EPP server
> version(this can be seen in the bottom-right corner of the EPP UI, the
> latest version is 5940).
>
> Please let me know if there is any additional information that we can
> provide and if/when you would like to schedule a remote session with us to
> assist with the migration.
>
> Best Regards,
> *Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer*

Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #419597 - - Server OS Update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0F7bOq:ref ]

TextBody:
Hi Jeffrey,

I believe that that message is received when there is not enough space on the disk for the backups to occur when upgrading.

We can schedule a remote session so we can take a look together and free some space if needed. Please let me know if you have availability this Thursday for a remote session.

We will need port 62828 to be open in AWS for the IP of the computer from which we will connect(Example: your IP).

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Jeffrey Plotts [jplotts@blend.com]
Sent: 11/12/2024 9:14 PM
To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #419597 - - Server OS Update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0F7bOq:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000F7bOq:ref
 
Hello Flaviu,
Thank you. I'm attempting to update the EPP server instance to the latest version, but it seems to be "stuck" at 87.5% "updating database". It's been a few days and I just rebooted the host OS, but when I logged back in it's still at the same % as when I restarted. What can I do to get the server to advance beyond this?

 


On Fri, Nov 8, 2024 at 2:18 PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please find the answers below:
The EPP clients only care about the IP/DNS/FQDN used. I would recommend only swapping the IP's of the EPP servers, or updating the IP on the EPP clients once the migration is completed.
If we migrate the EPP server the certificates applied on the EPP server should also be present on the new EPP server after the migration is completed.

Regarding the preparatory steps that need to be taken before the migration, I would recommend having a remote session with us when you either migrate so we can assist. The most important steps prior to the migration are:
1. Creating a Snapshot of the EPP servers, so we have a point of return.
2. Making sure that both EPP servers are on the same EPP server version(this can be seen in the bottom-right corner of the EPP UI, the latest version is 5940).

Please let me know if there is any additional information that we can provide and if/when you would like to schedule a remote session with us to assist with the migration.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

I've installed all the security agents required on the system and have confirmed it's logging to our SIEMs host, I believe we're ready to migrate the data and settings, but have a few questions, such as;

will the connected clients "care" if the new EPP server name is the same as the current host? this relates to whether i need to have a new TLS cert created using the current host name or use one with the current AWS host name we've created

will the Active Directory connector be migrated as a part of the process?

are there additional preparatory steps I should take prior to the migration?

please suggest a time this coming week for our next call

Thanks for your help, hope you have a nice weekend!

On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:53?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #419597 - - Server OS Update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0F7bOq:ref ]

Hi Jeffrey,

Thank you for the remote session!

As we spoke I believe an older EPP Server version was installed. We will wait to hear back from you once the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04 is installed.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

On Wed, Sep 4, 2024 at 10:29?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

We have just received an update from our colleagues.

We can provide you with an AWS image with the EPP server version 5.8.1.0. This we will upgrade afterwards when performing the migration to the latest 5.9.4.0 version.

Unfortunately we only have images on Ubuntu 22.04.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

On Tue, Nov 12, 2024 at 11:40 AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

I believe that that message is received when there is not enough space on the disk for the backups to occur when upgrading.

We can schedule a remote session so we can take a look together and free some space if needed. Please let me know if you have availability this Thursday for a remote session.

We will need port 62828 to be open in AWS for the IP of the computer from which we will connect(Example: your IP).

Best Regards,

Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #419597 - - Server OS Update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0F7bOq:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000F7bOq:ref
 
Hello Flaviu,
Thank you. I'm attempting to update the EPP server instance to the latest version, but it seems to be "stuck" at 87.5% "updating database". It's been a few days and I just rebooted the host OS, but when I logged back in it's still at the same % as when I restarted. What can I do to get the server to advance beyond this?

 


On Fri, Nov 8, 2024 at 2:18?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please find the answers below:
The EPP clients only care about the IP/DNS/FQDN used. I would recommend only swapping the IP's of the EPP servers, or updating the IP on the EPP clients once the migration is completed.
If we migrate the EPP server the certificates applied on the EPP server should also be present on the new EPP server after the migration is completed.

Regarding the preparatory steps that need to be taken before the migration, I would recommend having a remote session with us when you either migrate so we can assist. The most important steps prior to the migration are:
1. Creating a Snapshot of the EPP servers, so we have a point of return.
2. Making sure that both EPP servers are on the same EPP server version(this can be seen in the bottom-right corner of the EPP UI, the latest version is 5940).

Please let me know if there is any additional information that we can provide and if/when you would like to schedule a remote session with us to assist with the migration.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #419597 - - Server OS Update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0F7bOq:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000F7bOq:ref
 
Hello Flaviu, 
I've installed all the security agents required on the system and have confirmed it's logging to our SIEMs host, I believe we're ready to migrate the data and settings, but have a few questions, such as;

will the connected clients "care" if the new EPP server name is the same as the current host? this relates to whether i need to have a new TLS cert created using the current host name or use one with the current AWS host name we've created

will the Active Directory connector be migrated as a part of the process?

are there additional preparatory steps I should take prior to the migration?

please suggest a time this coming week for our next call

Thanks for your help, hope you have a nice weekend!

 


On Thu, Nov 7, 2024 at 1:12?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Thank you for the remote session!

As we spoke we did the following:
- created a SSH Access account for you
- re-partitioned the free space on the EPP server

We will wait to hear back from you next week so we can proceed with the migration.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:53?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,

On Wed, Sep 4, 2024 at 10:29?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

We have just received an update from our colleagues.

We can provide you with an AWS image with the EPP server version 5.8.1.0. This we will upgrade afterwards when performing the migration to the latest 5.9.4.0 version.

Unfortunately we only have images on Ubuntu 22.04.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Best Regards,

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> the old one.

>>>> Hi Jeffrey,
>>>>
>>>> Please find the answers below:
>>>> The EPP clients only care about the IP/DNS/FQDN used. I would recommend
>>>> only swapping the IP's of the EPP servers, or updating the IP on the EPP
>>>> clients once the migration is completed.
>>>> If we migrate the EPP server the certificates applied on the EPP server
>>>> should also be present on the new EPP server after the migration is
>>>> completed.
>>>>
>>>> Regarding the preparatory steps that need to be taken before the
>>>> migration, I would recommend having a remote session with us when you
>>>> either migrate so we can assist. The most important steps prior to the
>>>> migration are:
>>>> 1. Creating a Snapshot of the EPP servers, so we have a point of return.
>>>> 2. Making sure that both EPP servers are on the same EPP server
>>>> version(this can be seen in the bottom-right corner of the EPP UI, the
>>>> latest version is 5940).
>>>>
>>>> Please let me know if there is any additional information that we can
>>>> provide and if/when you would like to schedule a remote session with us to
>>>> assist with the migration.
>>>>
>>>> Best Regards,

>>>>>>>>>> servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to

>>>>>>>>>> new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the
>>>>>>>>>> old one.

>>>>>>>>>> access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before
>>>>>>>>>> installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

On Fri, Nov 8, 2024 at 2:18?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please find the answers below:
The EPP clients only care about the IP/DNS/FQDN used. I would recommend only swapping the IP's of the EPP servers, or updating the IP on the EPP clients once the migration is completed.
If we migrate the EPP server the certificates applied on the EPP server should also be present on the new EPP server after the migration is completed.

Regarding the preparatory steps that need to be taken before the migration, I would recommend having a remote session with us when you either migrate so we can assist. The most important steps prior to the migration are:
1. Creating a Snapshot of the EPP servers, so we have a point of return.
2. Making sure that both EPP servers are on the same EPP server version(this can be seen in the bottom-right corner of the EPP UI, the latest version is 5940).

Please let me know if there is any additional information that we can provide and if/when you would like to schedule a remote session with us to assist with the migration.

Best Regards,

On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:53?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

TextBody:
Hi Jeffrey,

Thank you for the remote session!

As we spoke we tried upgrading the 5810 image, but it gave some UI visual inaccuracies.

We asked our devops team to share with you the latest AWS EPP server image they have. We will get back to you once it is shared.

Steps remaining after receiving the image:
- installing it on your end
- moving the settings from the old EPP server to the new one
- checking to make sure they are a 1-to-1 match
- swapping the IP's of the 2 servers or updating the EPP client IP's so they communicate with the new EPP server.

Best Regards,

On Fri, Nov 8, 2024 at 2:18?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please find the answers below:
The EPP clients only care about the IP/DNS/FQDN used. I would recommend only swapping the IP's of the EPP servers, or updating the IP on the EPP clients once the migration is completed.
If we migrate the EPP server the certificates applied on the EPP server should also be present on the new EPP server after the migration is completed.

Regarding the preparatory steps that need to be taken before the migration, I would recommend having a remote session with us when you either migrate so we can assist. The most important steps prior to the migration are:
1. Creating a Snapshot of the EPP servers, so we have a point of return.
2. Making sure that both EPP servers are on the same EPP server version(this can be seen in the bottom-right corner of the EPP UI, the latest version is 5940).

Please let me know if there is any additional information that we can provide and if/when you would like to schedule a remote session with us to assist with the migration.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:53?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

On Wed, Sep 4, 2024 at 10:29?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

We have just received an update from our colleagues.

We can provide you with an AWS image with the EPP server version 5.8.1.0. This we will upgrade afterwards when performing the migration to the latest 5.9.4.0 version.

Unfortunately we only have images on Ubuntu 22.04.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

On Fri, Nov 8, 2024 at 2:18?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please find the answers below:
The EPP clients only care about the IP/DNS/FQDN used. I would recommend only swapping the IP's of the EPP servers, or updating the IP on the EPP clients once the migration is completed.
If we migrate the EPP server the certificates applied on the EPP server should also be present on the new EPP server after the migration is completed.

Regarding the preparatory steps that need to be taken before the migration, I would recommend having a remote session with us when you either migrate so we can assist. The most important steps prior to the migration are:
1. Creating a Snapshot of the EPP servers, so we have a point of return.
2. Making sure that both EPP servers are on the same EPP server version(this can be seen in the bottom-right corner of the EPP UI, the latest version is 5940).

Please let me know if there is any additional information that we can provide and if/when you would like to schedule a remote session with us to assist with the migration.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

On Wed, Sep 4, 2024 at 10:29?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

We have just received an update from our colleagues.

We can provide you with an AWS image with the EPP server version 5.8.1.0. This we will upgrade afterwards when performing the migration to the latest 5.9.4.0 version.

Unfortunately we only have images on Ubuntu 22.04.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

www.endpointprotector.com

On Fri, Nov 8, 2024 at 2:18?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please find the answers below:
The EPP clients only care about the IP/DNS/FQDN used. I would recommend only swapping the IP's of the EPP servers, or updating the IP on the EPP clients once the migration is completed.
If we migrate the EPP server the certificates applied on the EPP server should also be present on the new EPP server after the migration is completed.

Regarding the preparatory steps that need to be taken before the migration, I would recommend having a remote session with us when you either migrate so we can assist. The most important steps prior to the migration are:
1. Creating a Snapshot of the EPP servers, so we have a point of return.
2. Making sure that both EPP servers are on the same EPP server version(this can be seen in the bottom-right corner of the EPP UI, the latest version is 5940).

Please let me know if there is any additional information that we can provide and if/when you would like to schedule a remote session with us to assist with the migration.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:53?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #419597 - - Server OS Update [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0F7bOq:ref ]

Hi Jeffrey,

Thank you for the remote session!

As we spoke I believe an older EPP Server version was installed. We will wait to hear back from you once the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04 is installed.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

On Wed, Sep 4, 2024 at 10:29?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

We have just received an update from our colleagues.

We can provide you with an AWS image with the EPP server version 5.8.1.0. This we will upgrade afterwards when performing the migration to the latest 5.9.4.0 version.

Unfortunately we only have images on Ubuntu 22.04.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix

www.endpointprotector.com

>>>>>> The EPP clients only care about the IP/DNS/FQDN used. I would
>>>>>> recommend only swapping the IP's of the EPP servers, or updating the IP on
>>>>>> the EPP clients once the migration is completed.
>>>>>> If we migrate the EPP server the certificates applied on the EPP
>>>>>> server should also be present on the new EPP server after the migration is
>>>>>> completed.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> Regarding the preparatory steps that need to be taken before the
>>>>>> migration, I would recommend having a remote session with us when you
>>>>>> either migrate so we can assist. The most important steps prior to the
>>>>>> migration are:

>>>>>> return.

On Fri, Nov 8, 2024 at 2:18?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please find the answers below:
The EPP clients only care about the IP/DNS/FQDN used. I would recommend only swapping the IP's of the EPP servers, or updating the IP on the EPP clients once the migration is completed.
If we migrate the EPP server the certificates applied on the EPP server should also be present on the new EPP server after the migration is completed.

Regarding the preparatory steps that need to be taken before the migration, I would recommend having a remote session with us when you either migrate so we can assist. The most important steps prior to the migration are:
1. Creating a Snapshot of the EPP servers, so we have a point of return.
2. Making sure that both EPP servers are on the same EPP server version(this can be seen in the bottom-right corner of the EPP UI, the latest version is 5940).

Please let me know if there is any additional information that we can provide and if/when you would like to schedule a remote session with us to assist with the migration.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix

www.endpointprotector.com

On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:53?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

Hi Jeffrey,

Thank you for the remote session!

As we spoke I believe an older EPP Server version was installed. We will wait to hear back from you once the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04 is installed.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,

On Wed, Sep 4, 2024 at 10:29?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

We have just received an update from our colleagues.

We can provide you with an AWS image with the EPP server version 5.8.1.0. This we will upgrade afterwards when performing the migration to the latest 5.9.4.0 version.

Unfortunately we only have images on Ubuntu 22.04.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

On Fri, Nov 8, 2024 at 2:18?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please find the answers below:
The EPP clients only care about the IP/DNS/FQDN used. I would recommend only swapping the IP's of the EPP servers, or updating the IP on the EPP clients once the migration is completed.
If we migrate the EPP server the certificates applied on the EPP server should also be present on the new EPP server after the migration is completed.

Regarding the preparatory steps that need to be taken before the migration, I would recommend having a remote session with us when you either migrate so we can assist. The most important steps prior to the migration are:
1. Creating a Snapshot of the EPP servers, so we have a point of return.
2. Making sure that both EPP servers are on the same EPP server version(this can be seen in the bottom-right corner of the EPP UI, the latest version is 5940).

Please let me know if there is any additional information that we can provide and if/when you would like to schedule a remote session with us to assist with the migration.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:53?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,

On Wed, Sep 4, 2024 at 10:29?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

We have just received an update from our colleagues.

We can provide you with an AWS image with the EPP server version 5.8.1.0. This we will upgrade afterwards when performing the migration to the latest 5.9.4.0 version.

Unfortunately we only have images on Ubuntu 22.04.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Best Regards,

On Fri, Nov 8, 2024 at 2:18?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please find the answers below:
The EPP clients only care about the IP/DNS/FQDN used. I would recommend only swapping the IP's of the EPP servers, or updating the IP on the EPP clients once the migration is completed.
If we migrate the EPP server the certificates applied on the EPP server should also be present on the new EPP server after the migration is completed.

Regarding the preparatory steps that need to be taken before the migration, I would recommend having a remote session with us when you either migrate so we can assist. The most important steps prior to the migration are:
1. Creating a Snapshot of the EPP servers, so we have a point of return.
2. Making sure that both EPP servers are on the same EPP server version(this can be seen in the bottom-right corner of the EPP UI, the latest version is 5940).

Please let me know if there is any additional information that we can provide and if/when you would like to schedule a remote session with us to assist with the migration.

Best Regards,

Hi Jeffrey,

Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

>>>>>>> Hi Jeffrey,
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Please find the answers below:
>>>>>>> The EPP clients only care about the IP/DNS/FQDN used. I would
>>>>>>> recommend only swapping the IP's of the EPP servers, or updating the IP on
>>>>>>> the EPP clients once the migration is completed.
>>>>>>> If we migrate the EPP server the certificates applied on the EPP
>>>>>>> server should also be present on the new EPP server after the migration is
>>>>>>> completed.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Regarding the preparatory steps that need to be taken before the
>>>>>>> migration, I would recommend having a remote session with us when you
>>>>>>> either migrate so we can assist. The most important steps prior to the
>>>>>>> migration are:
>>>>>>> 1. Creating a Snapshot of the EPP servers, so we have a point of
>>>>>>> return.
>>>>>>> 2. Making sure that both EPP servers are on the same EPP server
>>>>>>> version(this can be seen in the bottom-right corner of the EPP UI, the
>>>>>>> latest version is 5940).
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Please let me know if there is any additional information that we
>>>>>>> can provide and if/when you would like to schedule a remote session with us
>>>>>>> to assist with the migration.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Best Regards,
>>>>>>> *Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer*

On Fri, Nov 8, 2024 at 2:18?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please find the answers below:
The EPP clients only care about the IP/DNS/FQDN used. I would recommend only swapping the IP's of the EPP servers, or updating the IP on the EPP clients once the migration is completed.
If we migrate the EPP server the certificates applied on the EPP server should also be present on the new EPP server after the migration is completed.

Regarding the preparatory steps that need to be taken before the migration, I would recommend having a remote session with us when you either migrate so we can assist. The most important steps prior to the migration are:
1. Creating a Snapshot of the EPP servers, so we have a point of return.
2. Making sure that both EPP servers are on the same EPP server version(this can be seen in the bottom-right corner of the EPP UI, the latest version is 5940).

Please let me know if there is any additional information that we can provide and if/when you would like to schedule a remote session with us to assist with the migration.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:53?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

Please let us know if you had a chance to install the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer

Hi Jeffrey,

Thank you for the remote session!

As we spoke I believe an older EPP Server version was installed. We will wait to hear back from you once the 5.8.1.0 EPP server with Ubuntu 22.04 is installed.

After that we will proceed with the following steps:

1. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
2. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
3. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
4. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Once we migrate you should have the old server SSH access / host access in order to install the 3rd party tools you mentioned. Before installing them we strongly recommend creating a snapshot of the EPP server.

Best Regards,

On Wed, Sep 4, 2024 at 10:29?AM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Jeffrey,

We have just received an update from our colleagues.

We can provide you with an AWS image with the EPP server version 5.8.1.0. This we will upgrade afterwards when performing the migration to the latest 5.9.4.0 version.

Unfortunately we only have images on Ubuntu 22.04.

The list of steps to perform the migration would be:
1. Providing you with the Ubuntu 22.04 image in AWS. We would need some information from your side in order to share this image with you.
2. After you install the image on your end and allocate it an IP we will schedule a remote session.
3. We will upgrade the new image to 5.9.4.0.
4. We will perform a System backup V2 migration(which does not contain the logs).
5. You will then have to either swap the IP's between the 2 EPP servers(old and new). This is in order for the EPP clients to connect to the new server and send the logs there from now on.
6. We will make a final check, a comparison between the old and new EPP server to make sure that the new one is a mirrored version of the old one.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
